intro: Discopodium penninervium, commonly known as the narrow-veined disc moss, is a species of liverwort belonging to the family Pottiaceae. It is a small, mat-forming plant that typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or rocky crevices. The plant has a delicate, greenish-yellow appearance with a dense, cushion-like structure composed of tightly packed leaves. Its leaves are usually narrow and have a distinct midrib, which is a characteristic feature of the species. Discopodium penninervium is often found in temperate regions and is an important component of the microflora in woodland ecosystems.
